distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Updated librsvg2 packages that fix one security issue are now available for
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.

The Red Hat Security Response Team has rated this update as having moderate
security impact. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score,
which gives a detailed severity rating, is available from the CVE link in
the References section.

[Updated Feb 4, 2014]
The original packages distributed with this advisory contained a bug that
caused applications using librsvg2 to crash when loading certain SVG
images. We have updated the packages to correct this bug.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The librsvg2 packages provide an SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) library
based on libart.

An XML External Entity expansion flaw was found in the way librsvg2
processed SVG files. If a user were to open a malicious SVG file, a remote
attacker could possibly obtain a copy of the local resources that the user
had access to. (CVE-2013-1881)

All librsvg2 users are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain a backported patch to correct this issue. All running applications
that use librsvg2 must be restarted for this update to take effect.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: GNOME libsvg before 2.39.0 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via an XML document containing an external entity declaration in conjunction with an entity reference, related to an XML External Entity (XXE) issue.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: librsvg2: local resource access vulnerability due to XML External Entity enablement
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of librsvg2 as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to use the
Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/site/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: librsvg2: local resource access vulnerability due to XML External Entity enablement
